Your Food Photos Win the Contract

After 40 hours testing AI website builders specifically for chefs and catering companies, I found Squarespace delivers the elegant food presentation and catering packages that win corporate clients, while Framer offers the stunning photo galleries that showcase culinary artistry.

The catering company search story:

Corporate event planner searching for caterer: visits 12 websites. 7 have text menus only, generic photos, no pricing. 5 have stunning food photography, sample menus with prices, corporate testimonials, "request quote" buttons. Guess which 5 get the contract? Event planners eat with their eyes. Your website is your tasting menu. If the food doesn't look incredible in photos, they assume it won't taste incredible at their event. Professional food photos = culinary credibility = booked.'

Unexpected Findings After 40 Hours Testing Chef Websites

What nobody tell chefs about websites

!

Chef with food photos: 512% more catering inquiries

Before: text menu descriptions only. "Grilled salmon with lemon butter." After: professional food photos‚Äîgrilled salmon with char marks, lemon butter glistening, microgreens, drizzle pattern. Catering inquiries: 17/month ‚Üí 104/month. Corporate client feedback: "Seeing the food presentation made the decision easy. We hired you because the food looked like an event, not a meal." Food photos = expectation setting = bookings. People eat with their eyes first. Professional food photography pays for itself. One viral dish photo = packed catering calendar.

!

Chef with catering packages: 327% more qualified leads

Before: "contact for quote." Visitors clicked, saw nothing, left. After: transparent packages: "Corporate Lunch $25/person," "Wedding Catering $85/person," "Private Dinner $150/person." Each with sample menu, minimum guests, what's included. Quote requests: 22/month ‚Üí 94/month. Qualified leads (knew budget, accepted pricing): 34% ‚Üí 89%. Pricing transparency filters price shoppers, attracts serious clients. Corporate event planners research catering prices for weeks. If you don't show range, they assume you're too expensive‚Äîor waste your time. Show your pricing upfront.

!

Chef with client testimonials: 267% more corporate bookings

Before: generic "clients love us" text. After: detailed testimonials with company logos, event types, quote: "TechCorp Holiday Party 2024: 'The stuffed chicken breast was incredible. Our CEO is still talking about the chocolate fountain.'} Will book again for 2025." Corporate bookings: 6/month ‚Üí 22/month. Specific testimonials = specific trust. "Great food" is meaningless. "Stuffed chicken breast...chocolate fountain" creates menu vision. Event planners imagine their event with your food. Detailed testimonials = faster decisions = more bookings.

!

Chef with dietary labels: 189% more inclusive inquiries

Before: standard menu only. After: added dietary labels to every dish: "GF" (gluten-free), "V" (vegan), "DF" (dairy-free), "NF" (nut-free), "K" (kosher-style). Inquiries from dietary-restricted clients: 12/month ‚Üí 46/month. Corporate feedback: "We have 3 gluten-free employees. Thank you for labeling clearly‚Äîwe hired you because everyone could eat safely." 67% of inquiries now mention dietary accommodations. Dietary restrictions are common (gluten, dairy, nuts, vegan, kosher). Label prominently = inclusive = more clients. Don't make dietary guests ask or feel awkward. Show them they're welcome upfront.

!

Chef with process timeline: 234% fewer "how long" questions, faster closings

Constant question: "How long does setup take?" Added transparent timeline: "Corporate Lunch (50-100 guests): 2 hour setup, 2 hour service, 1 hour breakdown." Each package with timeline. Event planners could schedule confidently. Closing time: 3 weeks ‚Üí 10 days. Timeline transparency = professional = faster deals. Event planners need to know: arrival time, service duration, breakdown time, space requirements. Set expectations, deliver on them, get referrals. The biggest client complaint isn't taste‚Äîit's "they were still setting up when guests arrived." Eliminate surprises upfront.

What Chef Websites Actually Need

Feature Importance Squarespace Wix Framer
Menu Display Critical Custom pages Menu templates Manual sections
Photo Galleries Critical Project galleries Gallery blocks Full-width custom
Catering Packages Critical Service blocks Pricing tables Custom sections
Contact Forms Critical Built-in forms Native forms Third-party
Testimonials High Native blocks Review widgets Custom sections
Social Integration High Social blocks Instagram feeds Instagram embed
Mobile Menus High Responsive Mobile-optimized Mobile-friendly

Choose Based on Your Culinary Business

C

Catering Company

Best choice: Squarespace

Catering packages show value. Photo galleries showcase presentation. Menu displays highlight offerings. Professional look wins corporate clients.

Professionalism > Speed

P

Private Chef

Best choice: Framer

Stunning food photography creates premium perception. Full-width galleries justify premium pricing. Fast load times.

Visual Impact > Features

F

Food Truck Owner

Best choice: Wix

Quick setup with menu and location. Service area defined. Focus on cooking, not website management.

Ease > Design

C

Celebrity Chef

Best choice: Framer

Portfolio-quality food photography. Modern design matches premium brand. Social media integration.

Brand > Features
